_header: Harkeneth now both old and young / For Mary love that sweet thing
Title(s): Kyng of Tars and the Soudan of Dammas
_description: ‘þe Kyng of Tars and þe Soudan of Dammas’ — 1228 lines in 12-line stanzas (aabaabccbddb)

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
HErkneþ now boþe olde and ȝyngffor Marie loue
                    þat swete þyng…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Graunt vs alle in heuene lihtTo seo þi swete face.
                    AMEN.

Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BLAdd22283.First Lines:
HErkneþ now boþe olde & ȝingeffor Marie loue
                    þat swete þinge…
BLAdd22283.Last Lines:
…Graunt vs alle in heuene lihtTo seo þi swete face
                    AMEN
BLAdd22283.Attributed Title:
Explicit þe kyng of Tars & þe sou / dan of Damas (f.
                        128va)

Digital Facsimile of British Library MS Add. 22283 (‘Simeon’).

NLS1921.First Lines:
Herkneþ to me boþe eld & ȝingFor maries loue
                    þat swete þing…
NLS1921.Last Lines:
…& cristen men wiþ outen wenestriken of her heuedes
                    al bidene
